subtitle: Eight-Organ Creative-Institutional System
system_summary: COVENANT-ARK — 100 repos (all on GitHub), 90 ACTIVE + 10 ARCHIVED, 9 flagship repos with full community health files, 42 essays (~142K words), CLAUDE.md across all active repos (100% AI-augmented workflow coverage), community health files inherited org-wide via 8 .github repos, POSSE distribution live, Jekyll site with RSS, 82+ CI/CD workflows, Astro portfolio site with 19 curated projects, 33 named development sprints, system-metrics.json dashboard, ~410K+ total words. Methodology: process-as-product, solo production at institutional scale, AI tools used as compositional instruments.
strategic_context: The eight-organ system coordinates 100 repos across 8 orgs with automated governance, dependency validation, and a promotion state machine. 42 essays document the methodology in real-time. Evidence supports applications across: (1) Art-tech grants and residencies (sustained organizational capacity, process-as-product, governance-as-art), (2) Creative fellowships (documented creative methodology, solo production at institutional scale), (3) Selective technology roles (production-grade governance, autonomous infrastructure, multi-agent orchestration).
supporting_evidence: Artists like Julian Oliver, Nicky Case, and Hundred Rabbits (Devine Lu Linvega & Rekka Bellum) treat protocols and governance structures as primary artistic output, demonstrating that small-scale sustainable creative infrastructure with extensive documentation receives institutional recognition. Programs like Creative Capital, Artadia, Processing Foundation Fellowship, and Google Creative Lab explicitly evaluate infrastructure contribution, sustained practice, and organizational capacity.
strategic_opportunity: Position the eight-organ system as evidence of: (a) a living creative work where governance is the medium (art grants, residencies), (b) long-term digital capacity and sustainability (fellowships), (c) production-grade systems thinking (selective tech roles), (d) community contribution and reusable infrastructure (community-focused funding).
